content: hello crafters welcome dm's crafts happy Father's Day for all those father's out
there today that infamous DM Scotty is going to show you how to do a dino verse
thanks Dana daughter for that introduction here have a toothpick and
this is gonna be the start of my craft so I'm gonna cut the sharp ends off this
toothpick and I'm gonna bend at a 90 degree angle without breaking it off and
now I'm gonna get an older toothpick and give the same same piece about the same
size now I'm gonna put this in a plastic tray and glue this with some white glue
together I'm trying to make like a strut so I can hold the Dino meat up while
it's roasting so we'll let that dry and I hear out my little Dino now when you
do these you want to wash you want to wash these so that everything will stick
nicely to it okay and I got a just a regular toothpick and my craft goop and
I'm gonna loop this toothpick to the bottom the goal is to make it look like
it's cured but I won't do that yet now I've got my tea light I'm gonna use for
the fire okay if you haven't seen my tea light video make sure to watch that I'm
gonna score this so that the firewood I put on here will stick nicely to the tea
light okay so I'm just using an exacto knife and doing that I get crosshatch
pattern on the tea light so now I've got that done I'm gonna do the technique of
covering the tea light light it's flame itself with glue and just you just pull
up to the top of the of the flame and this is going to kind of simulate a
glowing roaring fire when we're done so let me show you what that looks like
I'll hit the light and turn on the switch and there we go we'll have a nice
glowing flame there so that'll be in a nice roaring fire for our Dino roast now
I've got some modeling paste here and I want to make it look like this skewer is
actually going through the dinosaur and not just on the bottom of it so I'm
going to fill in that area between the dinosaur and the skewer I'm gonna use a
toothpick and then pull up - it'll look like the flesh is kind of
going around that's you're someone give you a closer look there so you can see
how it looks like it's looks like more like it's skewer through the dinosaur as
opposed to just sticking on the bottom let that dry up and now I need to make
the the base for where the fire will be so I'm just gonna use a paper towel tube
and you know it's already round so that's half the battle right there right
so I'm gonna mark it mark the tube and let's cut it with my scissors and it's a
little too big right it's all trim it and then use my glue gun to shrink it
down a bit so it'll fit around the tea light not too tight but tight enough
there you go so now I'm gonna take my struts and I'll stick those as glue hot
glue those on the sides there and I've got the start of my Dino roast here make
sure those are secure on the side okay so there we go now I've got the the
beginnings of it so I still got quite a bit to do so now the next step is to
build up the edges around the fire okay so I'm use my toilet paper technique and
white glue all right so I'm going to glue around the edge of the fire and
this will help the toilet paper stick to it I'm just wetting the toilet paper I'm
not using glue at this point and I'm just gonna build up around the fire now
you see I put some glue on there and then that's because I'm doing different
levels here that'll help it harden up so I'm just going to keep building up the
layers and I want to get a nice tapered edge there so it's not just a you know a
huge lump it looks a little more there's like a little bit of a grade to it so
yeah that helps cover up that whole fact that there's a tea light in there it
just gives it to a nice blend into the surrounding
terrain so I'll put my last bit of glue on there and once I get that on there
I'll just let that dry up so now it's dried a bit not totally dry so I'm gonna
put some more glue on there I'll just put another layer of glue and this just
helps give it a make it makes it harder when it dries up so now I've got my
modeling paste again and I've got some small fish tank pebbles you can use
pebbles from the outside out of your driveway I'm gonna use a paste and go
around that edge because you can see the toilet paper roll or I mean the paper
towel roll is still sticking up past the toilet paper so I'm going to kind of
blend it in and then just start putting pebbles around the edge and this will
simulate that it's you know a fire that was built so get all those on there I
kind of get any excess off there blend it in and we'll let that dry up all
right so now it's all dry I'm gonna use my construction standard sand and white
glue and I'm just gonna glue around the base and I want to make it look like
just normal terrain so I'm gonna outside terrain so I'm just going to cover that
with the construction sand now that's dried you can see it didn't it doesn't
cover everything so I like to do a second layer with the white glue
particularly where the base meets the stones okay so I'm going to go around
there in particular and then cover up some of those Boulder spots with the

my tea light and it's about a centimetre to the edge right so I'm gonna take
these barbecues yours these old barbecue skewers and I'm going
to measure about a centimeter for each okay actually a little bit less than

I'm just using pliers because it's a rather thick piece of wood and I'll just
cut the rest out and I'll be ready so now I've got my pieces I can start

hot glue because this look at me time to work right if I use the hot glue it's
very hard to to work with the small stuff so I'll start going around and
first I'm just gonna kind of fill in the circle all right I'm just going around
and I'll fill that in and then when I get there I'm gonna start putting

right and I'll put some on the edge too so it's just so it doesn't just look

now here I've got my my base where the fire will go but you can see it has a
